problem:
Let $P(x)$ be the degree three polynomial with
\begin{align*}
P(8) &= \log 1, \\
P(9) &= \log 10, \\
P(10) &= \log 17, \\
P(11) &= \log 100.
\end{align*}Then $P(12)$ can be expressed in the form $A \log \frac{B}{C},$ where $A,$ $B,$ and $C$ are positive integers, and $C$ is prime.  Find $A + B + C.$
